titleInfo.title: Eliza Rhea Anderson Fain`s personal journal

mods.note: The most unique entry in Eliza Rhea Anderson Fain`s journal is about two slaves, Dick and Polly, who emigrate to Liberia from east Tennessee in 1842. The rest of the journal consists mainly of the Rhea family geneaology from the late 18th century until around 1840. The journal entries date from approximately the 1830s until the 1860s.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
